alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Laurens; Washington (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Laurens, southeastern Washington and north central Johnson Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Lovett, or near Wrightsville, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Wrightsville, Harrison, Lovett, Spann and Donovan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
